summary: Cloud computing is like having a powerful computer in the sky. Instead of using your own computer for everything, you can access resources like storage and processing power over the internet. It's as if all the computers and servers are a big, invisible cloud that you can use on-demand. You only pay for what you use, which can save money, but sometimes costs can add up unexpectedly. Large cloud systems are made up of many connected locations, each acting as a data center.
title: Cloud computing
